DataElement.preferredName: Disease Recurrence Relationship Radiation Therapy Exposure Location Outcome
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term representing the relationship of the site of disease progression to the area of radiation treatment.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Disease Recurrence Relationship Radiation Therapy Exposure Location
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A description of the region or relative location for the disease recurrence._A state of connectedness between people, objects, or events; to be associated or connected with something._Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation._The physical portion of the body at which the exposure takes place.

Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: dates on which observations of a disease response, including progression, have occurred.
ConceptualDomain.changeDescription: 11/17/21 changed WS from Retired Deleted to Retired Archived and added end date. Workflow status set to "Retired Deleted" in 3.0 deployment, was previously Deleted using the Admin Tool "Delete" function key. This function is no longer available.
